'glowing' suggests that it should work like the glow squid and glow ink: Display in full brightness, but not emit light. I think you meant to say that it should be a light source, which I think would be much better, too.

As far as triggering the light from torch flowers goes, my suggestion would be to make it dependent on the flower being on irrigated farmland. That way, you could control it with redstone, via a water dispenser! It would have the unique property of having a random time delay before turning on/off, due to the time it takes for farmland to change. 

Imagine putting fields of torch flowers in the floor of your base, covered by glass blocks or carpets, or having rows of them in the walls. You flick the light switch, and the lights slowly come on.
i want it to glow pls makeit glow

Bonemeal could be a method of causing the plant to permanently emit light and or flower glow, however by its default state it will never light up.

At its default state non lit; Walking through or colliding with the plant could temporarily create a light source or make the flower glow.

I like the comment that talks about the plant glowing when touching/walking through it. Maybe not for the torch flower, but imagine a grass or something that glows (not necessarily producing light), just like the yellow mushrooms in Minecraft Dungeons. Mojang did say they won’t likely add features from a spinoff to the base game, but an adaptation of them would be welcomed I think. Thoughts?
I hope too if Minecart system is good as well

It's not about the speed it's about the cost minecarts are really good transportation methods early game but they have a heavy cost so to make them better we can simply make it so that you'd need copper instead of gold for the powered version

Well, for those who are concerned more about the cost than the Speed of the Railways,
I'd say, for the amount of effort and time it takes to build a railway to connect a specific place with another, minecarts and rails should be atleast faster than Boats, Horses and other transports.

I see a few ways to improve minecarts. The first thing is coupling behavior needs to be improved. Minecarts that are coupled should be able to make it around corners, and should reliably stay together. Furnace minecarts should have improved function, like a way to turn them off and on. Like a lever on top of the furnace that turns it on or off. It would make sense to be able to load the furnace with coal rather than active it with coal. I can't say how we would change directions if the furnace was loadable with coal. I also think rail should be more affordable. At the current cost, it takes 64 Iron to make approximately 170 rail tracks, but I think this amount should be triples. If the crafting recipe used 2 iron instead, 64 Iron ingots would craft 512 rail tracks which seems much more feasible considering the effort to build a track of that distance. When I think of long distance travel, I'm thinking in the range of a 1000-2000 blocks, which is a lot of material at the current cost. For powered rails, somebody mentioned the use of copper rather than gold which makes sense but I think that might make them too cheap, and I like the idea of encouraging use of the furnace minecart; but they should be faster, or maybe have the ability to be chained to increase speed.
To many features arent distict enough to have a use minecarts are one of them, please upgrade them

No more chests. Let llamas, mules, donkeys and camels have the opportunity to hang bundles.
Love the idea but make the bundle hold 20 slots of items

I agree, but the storage should be larger, allowing a single chest to be put on each side. This could reduce the capacity to one rider, and incentivize single player users to actually use camels. In a single player world camels are obsolete when I could easily find a faster horse, or breed a mule to carry more inventory. This would align with the real world where camels can carry 900 lbs while mules can only carry 200 lbs.

Camels already have advantages over mules, donkeys, and llamas, who are the mounts for storage. If camels got it, it would render those other mounts useless. They all need their exclusive strengths and weaknesses.
